result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark Conrad Wisland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
No DNA sample and DNA surcharge ordered, the Court does not require multiple samples or surcharges and it has been ordered in case 15CT468.
Fine of $1,200.00 plus all mandatory costs, penalties, surcharges and $50.00 ignition interlock surcharge.
Payment of any applicable surcharges, costs, fees and fines are to be collected by the DOC from all applicable prison funds and wages, in an amount or a percentage which the Department determines is reasonable as well as during any applicable period of Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

*01-31-2018/ Judge David Hansher   
The Court ordered that the JOC shall be amended to state that the defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program after serving one year of confinement between 15CF2187 and 15CT0468 combined. *******************************************

*08-17-2017 - Court ordered JOC amended to state that the defendant is eligible for WSAP after serving one year of confinement time in cases 15CT468 and 15CF2184
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.
-Defendant does not qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program, but does qualify for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving one (1) year Initial Confinement in this case.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek  and maintain full time employment to the extent possible.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.

Mental health assessment.  Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
Any other programming ordered by the department or agent.
Alcohol and drug assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.  No positive results.

supervisions.notes: Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:  those as listed.
Court orders defendant restricted to operation of vehicles equipped with an ignition interlock device for 36 months to commence upon eligibility to reinstate license.
Court ordered AODA assessment and driver's Safety Plan.  Cooperawte with any treatment recommended.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.  Civl rights suspended until reinstated.

Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Mark Conrad Wisland in court with attorney Crystal L Saltzwadel.  Defendant Mark Conrad Wisland in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant sworn.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.  Any issues of restitution will be determined at sentencing.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 39 months, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 15 months with credit for 46 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 24 months.

Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:

*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment to the extent possible.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
*Any other programming ordered by the department or agent.

Restitution is set at $0 (ZERO).

Court ordered defendant to pay a fine of $1200.00 plus all mandatory costs, penalties, surcharges, and $50.00 ignition interlock surcharge.  Court ordered AODA assessment and Driver's Safety Plan.  Defendant to cooperate with any treatment recommended.  Court ordered defendant's driving privileges revoked for a period of 36 months.    Court orders defendant restricted to operation of vehicles equipped with an ignition interlock device for 36 months to commence upon eligibility to reinstate license.  

- No DNA sample and DNA surcharge ordered, the Court does not require multiple samples or surcharges and it has been ordered in case 15CT468.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Payment of any applicable surcharges, costs, fees and fines are to be collected by the DOC from all applicable prison funds and wages, in an amount or a percentage which the Department determines is reasonable, as well as during any applicable period of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment - payment must be made by the end of extended supervision.
- Defendant does not qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program but does qualify for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 1 year initial confinement in this case.

Appeal rights given.  
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Driver Assessment.

Defendant Mark Conrad Wisland in court with attorney Crystal L Saltzwadel.  Defendant Mark Conrad Wisland in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing.  Defense counsel received new offer and requests a short adjournment.  Court grants the adjournment.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 26.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 3, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defense counsel requests projected guilty plea and sentencing date.  She also requested defendant's other pending case 15CT468 be heard in Branch 26.  No objection from the Court.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 26.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 28, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Crystal L Saltzwadel in court, defendant Mark Conrad Wisland not in court, in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court addressed the prior bail confusion with parties.  Case was set back on our calendar after a return on warrant hearing that was heard by our pair court, Branch 35 on January 18, 2017.  The bail amount ordered by Judge Rosa on that date remains.

**JUDGE ROSA FOR JUDGE POCAN**
Attorney Crystal L Saltzwadel in court, defendant Mark Conrad Wisland not in court, in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court hears bail argument. All other terms and conditions of previously set bail to apply.  Status conference scheduled for February 7, 2017 at 08:30 am in Br. 26.
